channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Parents who strive to be ‘perfect’ for their kids can risk their own retirement security, report finds
item.description: 72% of parents report experiencing guilt while 35% put pressure on themselves to be the 'perfect' parent.

item.title: Eating your meals at these exact times could boost your energy levels and prevent chronic disease
item.description: Here’s expert-backed advice on how to time your meals and craft your day’s eating schedule.

item.title: Israeli Airstrike in Gaza City Leaves Many Dead, Health Officials There Say
item.description: The strike on a home left other bodies buried under the rubble, according to the Gazan authorities. The Israeli military said it had been targeting a ...

item.title: Ahead of the Masters, Golfers and Fans Load Up on Allergy Medication
item.description: The grass and trees at Augusta National Golf Club help make the course a treasure — but also an allergy nightmare.

item.title: Luigi Mangione Death Penalty Bid May Pit Prosecutors Against Each Other

item.title: Shopify is saying the quiet part out loud: AI will replace new hiring—other CEOs just won’t admit it
item.description: It is time for CEOs to level with their employees and for society to get ready for a world with fewer jobs.

item.title: Andy Jassy asked Amazon employees to call out all the red tape at the company and received almost 1,000 replies
item.description: Andy Jassy says he's on a mission to eliminate "bureaucracy" at Amazon.

item.title: Don’t move fast and break things—even with AI. Slowing down to speed up works better
item.description: Harnessing the potential of AI doesn't require moving more quickly—it requires deeper thinking and a long-term purpose.

item.title: Kim Shin-jo, North Korean Commando Who Sought to Kill South Korea’s Leader, Dies
item.description: He famously said the mission of a hit squad sent by Pyongyang in 1968 was to “slit the throat” of the South Korean dictator Park Chung-hee. He was 82.
